intro: Peucedanum saxatile, commonly known as the alpine angelica, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of theApiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its tall, slender stems can reach up to 1.5 meters in height, supporting clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, often spicy scent, making it a notable species in alpine botany.
